body.name: Final Fantasy XIV: Chronicles of Light (Novel)
editorialReviews: Editorial Reviews About the Author Square Enix, Inc. develops, publishes, distributes and licenses SQUARE ENIX®, EIDOS® and TAITO® branded entertainment content throughout the Americas as part of the Square Enix group of companies. Square Enix, Inc. is affiliated with a global network of leading development studios such as Crystal Dynamics® and Eidos Montréal™. The Square Enix group of companies boasts a valuable portfolio of intellectual property including: FINAL FANTASY®, which has sold over 164 million units worldwide; DRAGON QUEST®, which has sold over 83 million units worldwide; TOMB RAIDER®, which has sold over 85 million units worldwide; and the legendary SPACE INVADERS®. Square Enix, Inc. is a U.S.-based, wholly owned subsidiary of Square Enix Holdings Co., Ltd.

body.description: A collection of twenty-five short stories expanding upon the rich lore of Final Fantasy XIV and featuring exclusive illustrations by Toshiyuki Itahana.This hardcover, foil-stamped volume presents the twenty-one stories originally published on the official Final Fantasy XIV website, including “Tales from the Calamity,” “Tales from the Dragonsong War,” and “Tales from the Storm.” Additionally, it offers four stories written by the development team and appearing for the first time in Chronicles of Light, including “The Hunt Begins,” offering a glimpse into Zenos’s past, and “Ever After,” on Hien and the recovery efforts of Doma. Each story is accompanied by an illustration created specifically for this book by acclaimed Final Fantasy artist Toshiyuki Itahana. Read more

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 21, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A wonderful compliment to the game
reviews.reviewText: While I don't think reading this out of context will endear the characters enough to create brand new fans of 14, this short story collection is excellent for pre-existing fans. The stories are divided up into four sections, and cover from the very beginning of A Realm Reborn to after the end of Stormblood. Each of the stories really do help deepen the world and characters that are familiar to those who have played through the sections of the game's main story each section aligns with.Also, while most of the stories are available for free on the official website, the original stories are spread out to three of the four sections - as far as I can tell, A Realm Reborn is the only section where all of the stories are fully available. It also seems that the included illustrations for each story is exclusive to this collection.Given how long publishing generally takes, I don't believe the exclusion of Shadowbringers or Endwalker was due to anything other than them still being at least partially unreleased through most of the publishing process. However, I'm hoping we get a volume 2 in a few years (once we have 7.0 and a few patches + 2 years for the publication process)

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 27, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Good item to collect!
reviews.reviewText: I've been waiting on getting a copy of this book for years and I'm really glad that they decided to reprint it! The title on both the outer cover and actual cover are silver foiled and it has a really nice matte feel. There are exclusive art drawn for the book inside included for each story. The stories inside are from the after stories after the first few expansions along with one or two extras exclusively for this book? Anyways, this is a good item to add to your FFXIV book collection.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 5, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars It's a FF14 book!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on October 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Must Have FFXIV Merch for Lore Fiends!
reviews.reviewText: The art inside is gorgeous. The quality of the jacket and naked cover, front and back, is great. Highly recommend this book for fans of FFXIV! These short stories are available in-game but this is a must have item for lore fiends and those of us that can't get enough FFXIV.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on March 30, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Doesn't add much, but a nice collection of Final Fantasy flash fiction
reviews.reviewText: This book contains stories that were or are published on the Lodestone website (the social hub site for the game, Final Fantasy XIV). The stories are short, a few pages long, and mostly flash fiction. If you are a fan of the game you should buy this, and it's a great compilation of these stories in written form, but you won't be awed or amazed by the reveals. Most of the stories are one or two scenes long, and if there is a fight you might witness a brief clash but you aren't getting much more story value out of this book.None of these stories have integral lore required to appreciate or play the game (unlike other MMORPG novels, such as World of Warcraft's novels).

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 1.0 out of 5 stars 1 of the 4 Items we received was damaged.
reviews.reviewText: All of the other books did not have any problems but this specific one did. I ordered all the way from the Philippines so it would be a terrible hassle to go through the process of returning or to wait for the product to come back. Terrible.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on November 20, 2022
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars May you ever walk in the light
reviews.reviewText: Fantastic book to have that collects all the short stories listed on the FFXIV website. Now you can preserve them all in one place and recollect on fond memories.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 11, 2023
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Great addition to game
reviews.reviewText: Was a gift for my son he loved it
My inside fangirl is crying in happiness. I shall truely enjoy reading the new ministories 😀

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on April 7, 2023
reviews.reviewText: Came in perfect condition, and made a great gift.
Disappointed to say the least. Paperback quality, black and white, almost no art.
